solution_line_template: The book is $5 more expensive than the necklace, which means the book costs {necklace_price} + {book_more_than_necklace} = $<<{necklace_price}+{book_more_than_necklace}={book_price}>>{book_price}.
Both products which Bob wants to buy cost in total {book_price} + {necklace_price} = $<<{book_price}+{necklace_price}={total_spent}>>{total_spent}.
So Bob will spend {total_spent} - {spending_limit} = $<<{total_spent}-{spending_limit}={over_limit}>>{over_limit} over the limit.
